exclusion: Only a controller can remove the device from the network. After activating the exclusion function by the controller, the device can be removed by setting it in Learning Mode. If you are using the WiDom Multi Sensor Room Controller, the procedure of exclusion can be activated by Removing a node from the Z-Wave network and any click sequence on the integrated button; as soon as the exclusion initiates, the LED indicator starts a sequence of RED-BLUE blinks. The device is excluded from the network when the LED status indicator is solid RED and the App_status in the interface is OK.
inclusion: Before including the device the LED status indicator is solid RED. The procedure of inclusion is activated by clicking Add in the inclusion interface and by pressing any sequence of click on the integrated button. As soon as the inclusion procedure initiates the LED indicator starts a sequence of GREEN-BLUE blinks. The device is included in the network when the LED status is OFF and the interview is completed.
label: WDS2
overview: WiDom Smart Double Switch is an ON/OFF control device designed to independently control two separate loads, suited for being controlled by both remote and local switches. Similarly to the other WiDom “in wall” devices, it can be fully integrated into pre-existing systems and configured to associate configurable behaviors to a specific number of clicks, in full integration with the Z-Wave home automation ecosystem. There are two versions of WiDom Double Switch: L version controlled by Line signal; N version controlled by Neutral signal
usage:
Control Actions :

  • Holding the I1/I2 button change the status of Channel1/Channel2 and return to previous status as soon as the button is released.
  • A single and/or more clicks (Parameter No.1) on the I1 button turn ON/OFF the Channel 1 load.
  • A single and/or more clicks (Parameter No.2 and No. 1) on the button I2 turn ON/OFF the Channel 2 load.

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Numbers of clicks to control Channel 1
parameters.description: Define which sequences of clicks control the load connected to Channel 1/2.
parameters.overview: Define which sequences of clicks control the load connected to both Channel 1 and Channel 2, if parameter No. 2 is set to its default value. Otherwise parameter No.1 sets the clicks sequence only for Channel 1 and parameter No. 2 sets the clicks sequence for Channel 2

parameters.label: Numbers of clicks to control Channel 2
parameters.description: Define which sequences of click control the load connected to Channel 2

parameters.label: Value used for devices belonging to Group 2
parameters.description: Value used for devices belonging to Group 2 when I1 button receive 1 Click

options.label: Basic Set with same value of channel status

parameters.label: Value used for devices belonging to Group 5
parameters.description: Value used for devices belonging to Group 5 when I2 button receive 1 Click

parameters.description: Value used for devices belonging to Group 3 when I1 button receive 2 Clicks

parameters.description: Value used for devices belonging to Group 6 when I2 button receive 2 Clicks

parameters.description: Value used for devices belonging to Group 4 when I1 button receive 3 Clicks

parameters.description: Value used for devices belonging to Group 7 when I2 button receive 3 Clicks

options.label: Basic Set with same value of channel status

parameters.label: Timer to switch OFF the Channel 1
parameters.description: Defines the time after which the Channel 1 is switched OFF

parameters.label: Timer to switch OFF the Channel 2
parameters.description: Defines the time after which the Channel 2 is switched OFF

parameters.label: Timer to switch ON the Channel 1
parameters.description: Defines the time after which the Channel 1 is switched ON

parameters.label: Timer to switch ON the Channel 2
parameters.description: Defines the time after which the Channel 2 is switched ON

parameters.label: Local Scenario
parameters.description: Defines the behavior of the device Channels
parameters.overview: Defines the behavior of the device Channels when the I1/I2 buttons receive a valid number of clicks (see Parameters No. 1 and No. 2).

parameters.label: Start-up status
parameters.description: Defines the status of the device following a restart.

options.label: OFF_OFF  - Both Channel 1 and Channel 2 OFF
ON_ON - Both Channel 1 and Channel 2 ON
PREVIOUS STATUS - Status prior to restart

parameters.label: Type of external switch both inputs
parameters.description: Defines the type of external switch connected both to input 1 and input 2.
parameters.overview: Defines the type of external switch connected both to input 1 and input 2, if parameter No. 63 is set in its default value. Otherwise parameter No. 62 defines only the switch connected to the input 1 and parameter No. 63 the switch connected to the input 2.

parameters.label: Type of external switch input 2
parameters.description: Define the switch type connected to the input 2
